messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Cottonwood Farm - virus warning
messages.msgSnippet: ... You re right.  But, the virus simply replicated to all the addresses in their mailbox and copied the subject lines, too.  It didn t go through the list.
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>There is an email from Cottonwood Farm in my inbox waiting to be
>>opened. How does this virus work?
>
>
>I'm pretty sure attachments are stripped off posts to this list. No
>attachment - no virus.
>Tia
>
You're right. But, the virus simply replicated to all the addresses in
their mailbox and copied the subject lines, too. It didn't go through
the list. It was sent directly from their mailbox.

Don't open the email. Simply delete it. And then run your virus checker.

Tuck

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Cottonwood Farm - virus warning
messages.msgSnippet: I am Cottonwood Farm .  A couple weeks ago we contacted a BAD virus that circulated through our address book.  Our computer has been flushed out and no longer
messages.messageBody:
I am "Cottonwood Farm". A couple weeks ago we contacted a BAD virus that circulated through our address book. Our computer has been flushed out and no longer has the virus and now we have one heck of a virus protector. I would never send an attachment so delete the message if it comes with an attachment. I hope that's helpful.
Catherine of NM
----- Original Message -----
From: homeschoolmd
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 17, 2002 9:44 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Cottonwood Farm - virus warning


There is an email from Cottonwood Farm in my inbox waiting to be
opened. How does this virus work?

Pat

messages.subject: Cottonwood Farm - virus warning

"badtrans" virus.

The folks at Cottonwood Farm might want to run their virus scan.

Tuck
